1.title: Frontend Developer
1.description: Frontend developers build the user interfaces and interactive elements of websites and web applications.

scenarios.title: Morning Stand-up Meeting
scenarios.description: You're attending the daily stand-up meeting with your team. What do you report?

options.text: I'll share what I worked on yesterday, what I plan to work on today, and any blockers I'm facing.
options.feedback: Great! This is exactly what's expected in a stand-up meeting - concise updates on your progress and any issues.

options.text: I'll give a detailed explanation of all the code I wrote yesterday and how it works.
options.feedback: Stand-up meetings are meant to be brief. Detailed technical explanations are better for dedicated code reviews or technical discussions.

options.text: I'll just listen to what others say and not contribute unless asked directly.
options.feedback: Active participation is important. The team needs to know your progress and any challenges you're facing.

scenarios.title: Fixing a UI Bug
scenarios.description: A user reported that a button doesn't work on mobile devices. How do you approach this bug?

options.text: Immediately start coding a fix based on the report.
options.feedback: It's important to reproduce and understand the bug before implementing a fix.

options.text: First reproduce the bug, inspect the code, then implement and test a solution.
options.feedback: Excellent approach! Reproducing the bug helps you understand the issue, and testing ensures your fix works.

options.text: Ask another developer to fix it since you're busy with other tasks.
options.feedback: While delegation is sometimes necessary, you should first assess the bug's priority and your capacity.

scenarios.title: Code Review
scenarios.description: You're reviewing a colleague's pull request. What aspects do you focus on?

options.text: Just check if the code works as expected.
options.feedback: While functionality is important, code reviews should also consider code quality, performance, and maintainability.

options.text: Look for bugs, code quality issues, and suggest improvements in a constructive way.
options.feedback: Perfect! Good code reviews are thorough but constructive, helping improve both the code and the developer.

options.text: Point out all the mistakes and how you would have done it better.
options.feedback: This approach can be demoralizing. Code reviews should be constructive and respectful.
